DataElement.preferredName: Testicular Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Pathologic Regional Lymph Node N Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for the testicular carcinoma based on evidence obtained from pathologic examination through completion of definitive surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor Pathologic N Stage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TNM staging system.  N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A malignant germ cell tumor that arises from the testis. It predominantly affects young men. Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CRF standard harmonization. mc 1/31/17

ValueDomain.preferredName: Testicular Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer Stage Edition 7 Pathologic N Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of testicular cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of regional lymph nodes.  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer with no regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer with no regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Metastasis with a lymph node mass 2 cm or less in greatest dimension and less than or equal to five nodes positive, none more than 2 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Metastasis with a lymph node mass 2 cm or less in greatest dimension and less than or equal to five nodes positive, none more than 2 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension; or more than five nodes positive, none more than 5 cm; or evidence of extranodal extension of tumor. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension; or more than five nodes positive, none more than 5 cm; or evidence of extranodal extension of tumor. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 5 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 5 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pNX TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pNX TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer in which regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed.  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pNX TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer in which regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed.  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
